title: Sorry for this commit, consider this branch as a WIP
message:
Sorry for this commit, consider this branch as a WIP

I also had to bump targetSdkVersion to the last version because of a
bug in Android Studio : some methods on AppCompatActivity where not found
in the IDE.

It forced me to find a solution to the Bundle limit problem on API 25.
It was there all along : use the "loadAndCache" mechanism from the
existing SubscriptionHandler class. Only problem left : bound cache
size (otherwise it will lead to an OutOfMemoryError).

Work to do :

- Check on API 25+ emulator
- Fix AlertDialogs (they are displayed full screen...)
- Bound SubscriptionHandler cache size (probably using Guava Cache)
- ...

title: Bump gradle version plugin to 3.0.0-alpha
message:
Bump gradle version plugin to 3.0.0-alpha

I just love to live dangerously ! Some minor compatibility issues
with a method on ConcurrentHashMap, had to tweak code a little bit.

Gradle configuration file is also lighter, retrolambda and apt plugins features being included in android gradle plugin.

title: Merge branch 'develop'
message:
Merge branch 'develop'

* develop: (37 commits)
  Ugly fix to deal with unknown categories (a full category refresh is forced)
  Small refactoring to use lambdas instead of anonymous classes in service layer
  Bumped gradle plugin version
  Smileys are now centered in their container, which may help selecting them properly
  Removed unused import in ReplyActivity
  Added two new font sizes ("more huge" and "really huge")
  No title on ImageSharingActivity
  Added missing resources for quick navigation buttons
  Issue #25 : fixed quick navigation buttons colors on dark theme
  Issue #25 : implemented quick navigations button to scroll to the top or bottom of a page inside a topic
  Issue #36 : fixed a bug which caused reply button to be non responsive on the last page of a topic
  Issue #36 : removed unnecessary NestedScrollingView and fixed FAB behavior code
  Issue #36 : toolbar is now hidden on scroll on the posts screen
  Added a settings parameter in order to choose default image quality for rehost (preview as default value)
  Added a confirmation dialog before the actual reho.st upload
  Refactored ImageSharing activity for enhanced readability
  Override finish transaction for ImageSharingActivity
  ImageSharingActivity is now really invisible
  Added a share intent to be able to share online & offline image to reho.st without even being in the app
  Better state handling when image is inserted at a certain position in the EditText
  ...

title: Fixes issue #149 : topic comparison is now completely based on its identifier

Fixes issue #149 : topic comparison is now completely based on its identifier

Comparing topic objects with the usual equals() method doesn't work in some corner cases (for exemple, because the Topic object is now immutable, when its page count is updated, a new reference is created)

message: Fixes #102 : fixed app intent to open all HFR links (including rewritten ones) in the app

title: Fixes #45 : links from notification emails are now properly handled
message:
Fixes #45 : links from notification emails are now properly handled

Those links were kinda special, because they are in fact redirected (301) to another location, and so we needed to parse the redirected URL, not the original one (some vital details like the target page number are missing from the original link).

This led to a change in the UrlParser API, since we sometimes need to perform a network call to follow the redirection.

message: Fixes #100 : locked topics with new messages were not displayed correctly

title: Fixes #92 : status bar color was incorrect in night theme after context change (rotation)
message:
Fixes #92 : status bar color was incorrect in night theme after context change (rotation)

Can't explain why this bug is happening, the system should respect the statusBarColor attribute in all cases. I can't find anything wrong with the code, so the only way on fixing it right now is to force the status bar color programmatically. Pretty sure it's an Android bug.

title: Merge branch 'develop'
message:
Merge branch 'develop'

* develop:
  Fixed smiley search by switching to native forum search
  New setting to enable or disable internal browser
  Prepared new caching mechanism. Still not used in the app.
  Updated build tools version, support libraries dependencies and gradle plugin version
  New enter and exit animation for exif details screen
  Added a new exif details screen. Some important informations are still missing, but it's definitely a start.
  Bigger touch targets for smileys
  Switched to Timber for logging
  Fixed issue which caused spinner not to be displayed when changing page
  Internal browser toolbar now follow the app theme
  External links are now opened in an internal browser when possible (Chrome custom tabs)
  Fixed a bug which caused an indefinite spinner when the back button was pressed after a click on an internal link
  Fixed broken internal links parsing when no page was specified
  Issue #44 : implemented chrome custom tabs for opening images
  Issue #44 : implemented share action for images
  Issue #44 : images can now be saved !
  Cache profile in memory to avoid fetching it from the network all over again
  Bumped gradle plugin version in the main gradle build file
  Fixes issue #85 : prevent the app from crashing when rotating the screen in PostsFragment
  Bumped version number for next release

title: Merge branch 'master' into develop
message:
Merge branch 'master' into develop

* master:
  Yet another unnecessary reload fixed !
  [UI][Profile avatar] FIX: display the correct user avatar by fetching it in its profile - Add a profile field in the User class - Cache the active user in the UserManager - Make UserManager a singleton in AccountModule
  [UI][Drawer][Profile] Enhance the profile display in the drawer - Add some space on top of the profile zone in the drawer to avoid the status bar to overlap it - Make the profile image fit
  [UI][App Toolbar] Fix the topics list scrolling making disappear the App Toolbar and leaving a blank on top of the list
  [UI][Topic] Use a PagerTabStrip instead of a PagerTitleStrip - Now you can tap on the previous/next page title to switch on it.
  Revert "[UI][Topic] Use a PagerTabStrip instead of a PagerTitleStrip"
  [UI][Topic] Use a PagerTabStrip instead of a PagerTitleStrip - Now you can tap on the previous/next page title to switch on it.
  [Endpoint] Get the right avatar URL
  [UI] Enhance smileys handling - Add a button in the bottom toolbar of the reply screen to insert a smiley tag ([:]). Useful when manually typing a smiley tag instead of using the search. - Add a waiting wheel when performing the smiley search. - Add a message when no corresponding smiley was found.

* develop:

  Updated gradle plugin version
  Cleaned unused styles
  Removed hugo dependency Bumped material dialogs library version
  Fixed a performance issue causing all incoming cookies to be persisted at every network request. This was clearly unnecessary because cookies just need to be stored once (at login time) and then reused for every request.
  Issue #77 : Attempt to save and restore scroll position upon refresh, still a bit buggy...
  Issue #77 : WebView scroll position is now properly saved and restored
  Bumped version number for next release

title: Fixed bug #68.
message:
Fixed bug #68.

This was caused by the fact that the topics ViewPager was initialized too late in the fragment's lifecycle (onResume), which caused the "refresh requested" event to be received by pages 0 and 1 (current page wasn't set at that time, so default pages were the active ones).

title: Moved RxJava & Otto callbacks to onStart and onPause Activity/Fragment lifecycle…
message:
Moved RxJava & Otto callbacks to onStart and onPause Activity/Fragment lifecycle callbacks (may prevent some weird crashes from happening)

Crash reports show that sometimes, some methods like loadTopics are called after that onSaveInstanceState() was called by the framework. This might be because previously, components were unsubscribing from RxJava Observable's in the onDestroy() method, which is clearly too late to do any work.

title: Should fix issue #2, caused by multiple TopicsActivities started after login or…
message:
Should fix issue #2, caused by multiple TopicsActivities started after login or changing theme. New intent flags should make certain that only one instance of TopicsActivity is present.

Another part of this issue was the way the responses were cached, it should also be fixed now
